column4: i'm trying to update a friend's system which is way out of date (hardy), and am running into problems
i've tried apt-get install -f, and get "package is in very bad inconsistent state" and so on for flashplugin
flashplugin-nonfree: Depends: flashplugin-installer but it is not going to be installed
i should say the first error was "you have held broken packages" while trying to do a dist upgrade
should i just do a clean install or what?
try sudo apt-get install --reinstall -f Â flashplugin-installer flashplugin-nonfree libasound2-plugins
did you try the last command i gave you ?
oh, sorry - for some reason i don't highlight on bcmm_
now i just have the "held broken packages" thing, but i don't know how to list my held packages
that command seemed to help, it's running now
